title: Humanex Academy
text:
Humanex Academy is a <a href="private%20school">private</a>, <a href="alternative%20school">alternative</a> <a href="middle%20school">middle</a> and <a href="high%20school">high school</a> in <a href="Englewood%2C%20Colorado">Englewood</a>, <a href="Denver">Denver</a> <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, for students who have <a href="learning%20disability">learning disabilities</a> and emotional and behavior disorders. Humanex's three main teaching methods are an individualized <a href="academia">academic</a> <a href="curriculum">curriculum</a> which accommodates each student's current abilities, extensive counseling support, and behavior management. Humanex works with students who have learning disabilities, such as <a href="ADHD%20predominantly%20inattentive">ADD</a>, <a href="attention-deficit%20hyperactivity%20disorder">ADHD</a>, <a href="bipolar%20disorder">bipolar disorder</a>, etc.
Serving students in <a href="educational%20stages">grades</a> <a href="sixth%20grade">6</a>–<a href="twelfth%20grade">12</a>, Humanex Academy had 56 students in the 2007-2008 school year.
History.
Humanex Academy was founded in 1983 by Cheryl Okizaki as an alternative school working with <a href="at-risk%20students">at-risk youth</a>. In 1996, Humanex moved to its present location in <a href="Denver">Denver</a>, <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>.
